intro: Brodiaea capitata var. pauciflora, commonly known as the slender brodiaea, is a flowering plant native to California and southern Oregon. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces a basal rosette of leaves and has a short, stocky stem that bears the inflorescence. This variety is distinguished by its reduced number of flowers compared to other varieties within the species.
